title: Why We Don't Play Online Games - Kinda Funny Gamescast Ep. 54 (Pt. 2)
description:
We explain why we don't love playing games online.

Subscribe! https://www.youtube.com/user/kindafunnygames?sub_confirmation=1

This video was edited on an ORIGIN PC EVO15-S Laptop. Get your PC here: http://www.ORIGINPC.com

Each and every day, Tim Gettys, Greg Miller, and Colin Moriarty get together to talk videogames. 

Follow us on Twitter!
Tim - http://www.twitter.com/TimGettys
Greg - http://www.twitter.com/GameOverGreggy
Colin - http://www.twitter.com/NoTaxation

Music by Rakohus!: http://www.youtube.com/user/rakohus

transcript_chunks.text: We explain why we don't love playing games online. We've stated many times that we're not really fans of online gaming, and one reason is dealing with lag issues. It's also a consistent gameplay experience problem. I know how frustrating online gaming can be, and I understand the allure of dodging the headache altogether. Recently, I too have thought to myself, "You know what? I'm about done with online gaming." Even though I'm not entirely sure that's a reasonable thing to say given where the industry is and where it's going. All my favorite games are from the 90s, and more and more I feel like the magic of online gaming, which was there a decade or so ago, has all but lost its luster. I'm still thoroughly enjoying online co-op stuff, but the PvP stuff, even though I'm good at it, is always full of inconsistent experiences that are migraine inducing, so it's become a huge turnoff for me.
